website_summaries.verdict: For cars with an auxiliary input but no native Bluetooth, the GoGroove SmartMini Aux is an effective means of adding both hands-free call capability and audio streaming from a smartphone.
pros: The GoGroove SmartMini Aux's small size makes it easy to fit unobtrusively in a car, and long battery life means low maintenance
It supports voice pass-through to a paired phone's native voice command feature
cons: The single-button interface, with different hold times activating different features, can be confusing to use, and there is no ability to skip songs when streaming music

customer_reviews.title: Great Junk
customer_reviews.text: So this was exactly what I was looking for. If I sat down and designed exactly what I wanted to add bluetooth capabilities to my OEM stereo I couldn't have done any better. It arrived and was absolutely perfect. It worked absolutely perfectly. Music streamed exactly as it should. Calls were clear and sounded like I was talking on a handset. It lasted less than a week before the plug (I was using it plugged directly in to my stereo without the base) was pushed into the unit and it was completely inoperable.
customer_reviews.author: apdb90

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea, but it falls apart easily
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased two of these because they don't last very long. The first one lasted nearly 2 years, which was okay, the second one lasted about 4 months. Both regularly had issues connecting to my phone and then kind of fell apart after a while. The first one, the button fell through the opening, the second one the audio connector pushed into the body. I'm trying a different one next time. I like the design, and when it worked it did a decent job. I just wish it wouldn't fall apart so easily.
customer_reviews.author: William A. Dochnahl

customer_reviews.title: Poor hands free calling functionality, short battery life
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product to go hands-free in the car. It streams audio okay, but it is less convenient than an AUX cable. Pros -streams audio with pretty good sound -works with all apps -low profile isn't obtrusive on the dash Cons -you have to manually turn it on when you start the car -it takes longer to turn on than plugging in an AUX cable -The battery life is poor, so it spent more time plugged in with a cable running across my dash -when the battery isn't fully charged, on calls people complained of echo on the other end (making its hands-free call function worthless)
customer_reviews.author: Rorydawg

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok for $20
customer_reviews.text: I like that I can make cAlls and play musics thru the car speakers but u can’t listen to the radio and take a call. U have to switch to aux to make a call. Also I noticed if u do not turn off the speaker when u get out of the car, when you get back in the speaker won’t connect. U have to forget device and connect again. Also it takes a long time to turn it in and off and sometimes u can’t haar the on/off tone
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Microphone noise cancellation, and mic clarity.
customer_reviews.text: Plugged this into my Klipsch promedia 2.1 bluetooth edition directly into the aux, and the PC was connected to the bluetooth of the Klipsch . Both PC and bluetooth mic work without any audio noise from having 2 sources, which is nice. I am cheap this summer, can't afford central air, so I have 2 30" high velocity fans pointing at me at my workstation while I use this as my conference mic. My coworkers say my voice is a lot clearer than my previous bluetooth speaker mic combo, although it can be better. Wind/noise cancellation really works then.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Villamil

customer_reviews.title: Works good for me its a good buy for the money
customer_reviews.text: This little gadget is pretty handy it's easy to use and last a pretty long time. My first one I bought lasted a whole year, my second one lasted a couple months before I BROKE IT. My third one is still going strong if it breaks I'll probably buy another one. This is a product I'll keep coming back to. As far as performance goes my wife calls me all the time while I'm driving I just press the center button and she hears pretty clear even when I'm talking softly. The music sound quality is what I would expect.
customer_reviews.author: macon

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a cheap product that would allow me to listen to streaming music on my phone as well as answer phone calls without messing with my phone in the car. Overall, this product works very well for that purpose. Only thing I would change is for some reason, when I power this off it wants to turn my iphones voice control on (no big deal but annoying) and the provided velcro doesn't hold well for high temperature environments. Replaced it with a high temperature 3M velcro and haven't had any problems. Voice quality is great, streaming music quality is good (at 328 kbps) but don't expect disc quality.
customer_reviews.author: beattytd

customer_reviews.title: Not the best, not the worst
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this for nearly 4 years now, and it still works well, when it works, so I'd say it's fairly durable. It met my needs well initially (listening to music in my car via bluetooth), but I've had occasional, recurrent issues with it absolutely refusing to connect to Bluetooth. It's currently in that stage, so I'm shopping around for a different receiver now... who knows, maybe you won't have a problem; it seems to be more of an issue with my iPhone than it was with my previous Android phone.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Petersheim

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!
customer_reviews.text: This works great! EXCEPT, it doesn't autoconnect when you get in the car and also needs to be powered on and off everytime you get in the car. However, it is much better than having an aux cable draped across my dash. The sound is great and works immediately as soon as it is connected, which needs to be done manually each time. Luckily, I haven't minded so far w/ a longish commute to turn it on at the beginning of my trip. The piece is TINY and blends right into the car - isn't an eyesore at all. Highly recommend if you don't have bluetooth built into your car, which the Honda Ridgeline refuses to offer, unfortunately!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda M

customer_reviews.title: Decent buy
customer_reviews.text: It works well most of the time but it is difficult to use to make calls out or use it for voice to text. It often mistakes you trying to access your voice commands for turning it off and when that happens, you then have to reconnect it to your phone's bluetooth. My city has gone hands-free so that's very inconvenient and can be very costly if I'm caught trying to fix that issue. It does have great sound though and most of the time people are able to hear me without my having to raise my voice too much. Not bad overall.
customer_reviews.author: Regine2035

customer_reviews.title: Dongle
customer_reviews.text: Works great to transmit audio. It just plugs into any 3.5mm jack and looks sleek. Receives A2DP and doubles as a headset, with the built in microphone. The sound quality is amazing! I cannot hear any compression artifacts from the Bluetooth. There is a half second delay that you'll only notice if watching video. It does have an annoyance in that it starts the audio out quiet and fades it in after there's a break in the stream. This hampers navigation as you'll miss your prompts. I've overcome this by having music playing while I need navigation. It's annoying, but not a deal breaker, for me.
customer_reviews.author: Grantisimo

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Casing Makes an Incomplete Aux Connection
customer_reviews.text: The aux connection on this is really loose and seems to only work after adjusting it several times. It rattles around in the plastic casing. If the connection isn't complete the sound quality is terrible. The extension aux cable is also very cheap feeling and the sound quality when using it is bad too.
customer_reviews.author: S.G.

customer_reviews.title: great buy
customer_reviews.text: use it almost every day since I bought it. everyone always asks me what it is when they get in my car, and i show them, and they all agree how cool it is. now always with bluetooth being built into cars, this probably isn't needed as much. I do not use it to receive calls however, solely for its ability to send music from my phone and play through the cars speakers. Music sounsd great, and never cuts in and out. When the battery gets low on this thing, it makes a beep, which at first I did not know what it was, I thought it was a notification from my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Oropeza

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: This little Bluetooth system is quite the workhorse, I don't use the base, and just plug the unit directly into the aux plug. it sounds really good whether listening to music or talking on the phone. Everyone says it sounds like I'm holding the phone right up to my face while speaking. Just make sure your windows are closed. So the charger kind of sucks because you need a usb port and can't keep it plugged in while using it, but it doesn't matter. I went from a car that had integrated bluetooth, to a car that didnt. This still works better than the crap the Kia came with.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Scott

customer_reviews.title: Works with iphone but not android
customer_reviews.text: I had this for about a year with my iPhone and it worked fine until it stopped working... so I didn't fault it since it's so cheap its not going to last forever... so I bought another one but switched phones and now it won't connect to my android... i'm super annoyed!
customer_reviews.author: Dedicated Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great idea - a small package with a remote mike ...
customer_reviews.text: Nope. Nope. Nope. Great idea - a small package with a remote mike as well as headset/BT streaming adapter. However, it appears that my experience with the product is not atypical - it broke after about 3 weeks worth of use. I never even removed it from its base while I had it in the car, but the audio plug started failing with sound dropping out of one channel intermittently, then both, then silence. Replaced with a different make and model adapter, which has been chugging along for months now.
customer_reviews.author: Rob N.

customer_reviews.title: Not ready for Prime Time (even though it has been on the market for years)
customer_reviews.text: I liked the idea of this but something was lost in its execution. The bluetooth connection cut in and out too much considering my phone (a Galaxy S5) was only about 6 inches away from this. I wasn't a fan of having to always reconnect manually when I got back into the car but I did appreciate the auto off to save the battery. Also, having the same button for power, answering/ending a call and using voice features on my voice was hit and miss. Sometimes I could get the voice feature to work but most of the time, it just powered itself off. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Trimaniac

customer_reviews.title: This is what you need for your basic bluetooth functionality
customer_reviews.text: My car stereo doesn’t have bluetooth so I decided to look for a receiver, I came across this little guy and I couldn’t be happier, it did it’s job well to the point I recommended it to colleagues, I had to purchase another one chose my first one “died” to heat overload, I live in a tropical country so you could imagine what the sun is like If you want a very solid receiver, buy this one, you’ll get your money’s worth
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Kromopawiro

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: This works much better than I'd expected. I use it mostly to listen to audiobooks from my phone, but also for the phone capability. PROS: - Looks nice - Sound quality is excellent - Turns off with some intelligence (i.e. if you forget to turn it off when you leave your car, don't worry, it will do turn off a few minutes after you leave bluetooth range) - Though tiny the battery inside lasts me about a week, and I use this thing constantly to listen to audiobooks CONS: - Would prefer a standard USB micro port for charging. It uses a cable that, while perhaps not proprietary, is at least not one I've ever seen before. Don't lose it!
customer_reviews.author: J. Hough

customer_reviews.title: Died in 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. I use it to stream music to my car and as a speakerphone. The microphone is crystal clear, no static! Update: Was awesome while it worked, but as of mid February 2015, the bluetooth no longer works. At first I thought it was my phone, so I took it inside to attempt to connect with a few of my other bluetooth devices. Unfortunately, it looks like the bluetooth died. I'm very surprised and disappointed since this one got such great reviews on amazon and in a magazine that I subscribe to. I might try the motorola one next...
customer_reviews.author: AmandaFamanda

customer_reviews.title: Short life
customer_reviews.text: Bought 3 months ago. Like the look paired easily and automatically. About a month ago, had to go to settings and force connect, then it would seem to time out, maybe, and not pick up call or GPS direction. Now, lights are on, like it’s working, but won’t pair at all.
customer_reviews.author: Jim C.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great with minimal audio lag
customer_reviews.text: Worked great with minimal audio lag, but the plastic base around the stem has partly broken. The mini plug now pushes readily into the housing, so I have to take care to seat it securely.
customer_reviews.author: B. Pastoral

customer_reviews.title: best of 2 that I have tried!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried only one other of this type of bluetooth for my car. currently using it with a Samsung Galaxy 3. works well, minus 2 minor issues. every time I turn it on, I have to press the front bottom for it to actually connect to my phone (where as the other one I tried, it connected as soon as I turned it on) (I think it actually connected when I turned it on only once or twice since I have had it). it also engages the S-voice periodically/randomly when I turn off. again, these, to me, are minor issues. overall, it is a great piece of tech that I would gladly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Bolinger

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working quickly
customer_reviews.text: This thing stopped working very quickly. I guess the battery on it fried or something. I ended up going with a different device as a replacement. I wouldn't recommend this one. The sound was never great, and the hands free calling was worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Jayme

customer_reviews.title: Cheap in construction!
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about this except it's built really cheap and doesn't hold up. I have had to repair it several times by re-gluing the 1/8" plug.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Suter

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: First ordered the mucus minijack because had the best price and reviews online. Didn't pair as A2DP stereo with my phone, wouldn't wirelessly stream music to my car radio. Great customer service from that company but product didn't meet my needs so I returned it. Bought the gogroove, about same price, works flawlessly. Super pleased, plus this has a microphone so I can wirelessly talk on the phone through my car stereo and the microphone on the gogroove. The miccus mini-crap didn't have that feature and it had cost the same. Highly recommend the gogroove; used it for phone calls and for music, it's small discreet and works perfect
customer_reviews.author: E. A.

customer_reviews.title: Great for cars that have an AUX receptacle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son to use in his 2009 Toyota Corolla. He is very happy with it and said it works great when using his phone. The microphone seems to be sensitive enough to make his calls.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great way to introduce bluetooth to a vehicle without it!
customer_reviews.text: Great way to introduce bluetooth to a vehicle without it, must have aux in port. Everything about this product is very good. It does not turn on automatically, you must turn it on, and at least for my android phone, it then does pair automatically, after a one-time initial set-up. Sound is very good, everyone I talk to says they can hear things very well. Also when playing music through this device, the sound is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Jethro

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't auto connect
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is good, but I was really hoping for some autoconnect.. To connect with my phone, I have to hold down the button and and also navigate to the bluetooth menu on my phone and select to connect to it. As it stands right now, I have downloaded the app "bluetooth auto connect" on my android phone and set it to attempt to connect as soon as place it on my car dock/charger. I then have to hold down the button on the gogroove adaptor until it beeps. Even then, it doesn't always play sound right away. I hope I'm doing something wrong, because it's becoming a nuisance.
customer_reviews.author: Saeed

customer_reviews.title: Pairs easily with my Lumia 925
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Makes hands free driving very convenient. Even though my stereo receiver has bluetooth built in, it doesn't have an external microphone. The mic is essentially behind the dash and most of the time people can't hear me. I got this so I could actually talk to people through my car stereo and also have my voice to text understand what I was trying to say. Battery life seems to be as advertised. Lasts about 6+ hours. Can be charged while in use too.
customer_reviews.author: Gene C

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to function as a hands free telephone device and to stream MP3 files over bluetooth in my car. Setup was easy, took about 10 minutes. I paired the device with my Samsung Galaxy SII phone and it worked perfectly both for audio file streaming and telephone operations. Depending on your car, you may need to get a noise suppressor to plug in line with the device before inserting it into your aux connection. Battery life is fair, my estimate is 2-3 hours. Audio quality is excellent, and there is no echo on either received or transmitted telephone audio. Mj
customer_reviews.author: James M. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bluetooth 4 to 3.5mm adaptor and handsfree kit
customer_reviews.text: well designed and high quality product, works very well as a bluetooth handsfree device. however if using it to play music through your stereo and by no fault of the manufacturers the bluetooth audio quality is not perfect, there is quantisation noise from the bluetooth compression it does sound good enough for the average user but for audiophiles and enthusiasts it is an annoyance. As i said before this product is still a good product and it excels at what it does that is why it has still been awarded 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Balbosa

customer_reviews.title: Good balance; versatile jack
customer_reviews.text: PROs: Flexible mount options, but I just plug it in. Jack works for charging cable or other music source. Mutes other source during call. Supports phone and music/A2DP Great sound quality through car speakers Competitive price CONs: Caller says I sound like a tin can. (I don't with BlueAnt S4, but it's more expensive and its speaker doesn't compare with car stereo) Sound quality of other music source degraded a bit vs. direct connection. (Y-adapter might work but loses mute function, and this unit didn't fit tightly enough into the Y I tried.) IMHO a good choice overall
customer_reviews.author: jrc

customer_reviews.title: Great, But A Pain To Charge Battery
customer_reviews.text: This Bluetooth Kit was great in terms of being small and convenient, but it quickly became a pain to have to bring it inside everyday and recharge the battery. If you're looking for a Bluetooth Kit, go with]
customer_reviews.author: jediknight

customer_reviews.title: Very Convenient way to add Bluetooth and hands-free to any car with an AUX Jack
customer_reviews.text: Setup took less than a minute to pair with my phone and I was streaming music and talking call hands-free. The mic does a good job of picking up my voice and the system detects when a caller is to loud and lowers the volume. Mounting was simple. It comes with double sided Velcro and rotates so you can adjust it anytime. They only con is that it has no battery so you do need to keep it powered using your CIG adapter so you need a dual adapter to charge your phone at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Steven  M Owen

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend for music, not for calls
customer_reviews.text: Cheap way to make your car with an AUX port into a bluetooth enabled car. One draw back is that it doesn't turn off with the car, nor does it turn on with the car. It powers of some time after the car does and must be manually turned on by the user. Also, the microphone quality is lacking. People I am talking to often mention that they cannot hear me very well. All in all, simple to use and great if you want to listen to music/podcasts/gps directions through the car stereo.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Worked well ... until it died all of a sudden.
customer_reviews.text: My car has a headphone jack but no bluetooth so I bought this to wirelessly stream music. It worked great for about 2 years and then one day, the audio started sounding staticy. First I thought it was my headphone jack but I tried a wired connection and it sounded fine. Then I heard something rattling inside this unit -- but it is sealed I could not open it. Contacted the company but no response even though it comes with a 3 year warranty. UPDATE - company responded and sent me a replacement product!
customer_reviews.author: Zen Master

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and set up. Worked very well with my iPhone. Sound quality was good. I used it to stream music from my phone through my car stereo since it supports wireless bluetooth streaming. I did not use it for bluetooth calling since my car had handsfree calling. Battery lasted well when unplugged, though I mostly left it plugged in. The only negative is the status light is very bright and can be distracting when driving at night. I tucked it under an overhang in my car and that eliminated most of the light and made it usable.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremey

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because my car doesn't have Bluetooth and I got tired of plugging my AUX cable in every time I got in the car. Now, I can go completely hands-free and not have to worry about trying to find my phone every time it rings. It also makes it a lot easier to listen to the music on my phone, without cords getting in the way. I can even use it for my non-bluetooth sound system in my house.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty seamlessly - had a few bumps in the beginning
customer_reviews.text: Had some issues in the beginning with it, but once it hooks up to the Bluetooth it does a banging job - I've called friends and they say there no issues with them hearing me - and for me to comply with the hands free driving laws it's perfect so that I can hear my music off my iDevice and run the GPS component for traveling around my new city. Works pretty seamlessly - had a few bumps in the beginning, but I understand it better - if anything I wish the instruction manual was better
customer_reviews.author: B. J. LARKIN

customer_reviews.title: Not the best out there
customer_reviews.text: This works well when it worked but the jack that goes inside the mount came loose and would no longer plug in all the way so it wouldn’t work anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Delaney Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Solid performer
customer_reviews.text: After having bluetooth in my previous vehicles, I couldn't stand not having it in my new truck. Does what it says to add bluetooth functionality to my Dodge Ram with factory radio. Music sounds good and I have not had any complaints with voice quality. As others have stated, the lights can be somewhat bothersome but it isn't a deal breaker. My phone doesn't always automatically connect but I just go into BT settings and select it to pair. I do like how you can have a completely cord free setup if you don't use the mount and for the price, it saves me from swapping out the radio in my lease.
customer_reviews.author: D. Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Worked....BUT not anymore.
customer_reviews.text: **REVIEW UPDATE** Device stopped working after 2 months. Callers could no longer hear me. It had trouble staying connected when it would work. It's been sitting in my trunk for 3 months. Works great! Occasionally the caller on the other end will complain about road noise, but that's far and in between. If your looking for a hands free device, I would highly recommend this product. Only advice, buy some high quality velcro. The stuff that comes with it is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Perfect ! Best $35.00 Ive spent in a long time!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! I have a Kenwood DNX710 in dash unit, I was looking to possibly add the bluetooth unit to it- but it was $200.00 - I friend told me, to get this- that it would not only let me make & receive calls but listen to my iphone music/pandora, etc. I plugged it in, hooked it up, it synced right away to my phone, I tried the music, worked like a charm. Then I had someone call me, sure enough, the music faded out and my call came through...like I said, like a charm. I LOVE this thing. A+++++++
customer_reviews.author: Gina Hoskins

customer_reviews.title: No No No plz listen!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Listen carefully sound quality terrible doesn't work properly with certain phones like iphones samsung galaxy note 4 and edge plz try another product don't waste your time in money plus it don't have function buttons like the ikross bluetooth and the price is cheaper than this s***.One star was just to rate it that's about it i guess I can say the shipping was fast.
customer_reviews.author: Ap

customer_reviews.title: Junk.
customer_reviews.text: Was good for about 3 days. Then jack-to-port connection deteriorated. 1st slight buzzing, then only one speaker, now cant connect. Already threw it away. Save the $20 and get something else.
customer_reviews.author: Greg D 78702

customer_reviews.title: great promise for 2 weeks...
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this product to work. It is a great price for what it does. A bluetooth solutionfor the car. It even worked great. For 2 weeks... then somehow the blutooth just stopped working.... Now it just sits there as an ugly ornament. The light is on. It charges and all. But neither iphone nor android phone can connect to it anymore. extremely disappointed
customer_reviews.author: fullmetal

customer_reviews.title: Good but flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Fell apart. Tried to order a replacement to find the item has been removed from Amazon. Worked good while it lasted!
customer_reviews.author: Louman

customer_reviews.title: Easy pairing and operation
customer_reviews.text: Very easy pairing and operation, if the car receiver is being used with a CD or radio tuner, just switch to the aux imput, and then press the GOgroove SMARTmini button to answer a call, if the Smart Mini is used to stream phone music to the Aux input, just press the button. Only annoyance I have found is with a Samsung S4 mini Phone, if I am turning off the Smart Mini by holding the button without turning off first the phone bluetooth, the Samsung SVoice app is launched, even if voice recognition is turned off in the phone. Just a minor inconvenience tough.
customer_reviews.author: j&b

customer_reviews.title: Love this.
customer_reviews.text: This hands free is great. The main problem I have had with hands free Bluetooth is they are not loud enough when driving, and/or the mic picks up too much road noise. This works well. All I do is switch over to Aux on the radio and I can hear clearly and even with the Mic about 3 feet from me they can hear me clearly as well. This reminds me of the old hands free systems in cars that cost about $500, this is well worth the $26 I paid. I am actually getting a 2nd one for my wife.
customer_reviews.author: Taloncard

customer_reviews.title: Great value, some small issues noted below
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Great audio and voice quality. -Doesn't look terrible -Easily hidden, cable is quite long. Cons: -Nasty static through speakers when plugged into charger, even when powered off. Static is NOT present when device is transmitting audio. -Doesn't always connect at first or reliably to my Note 4. Sometimes I need to turn BT off/on and then it will connect. Occasional drops of signal even when less than 1 ft away in the car.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, call and sound quality is fine. Weird jack charging
customer_reviews.text: I had one before this and it did me well until it was stolen. This second purchase was fine until the jack itself loosened. Now I can't get proper use out of it. Def would recommend. Easy to use and voice calls are great. Blends well into my radio. Only gripe is the jack charging method but it's fine to use.
customer_reviews.author: nezimon

customer_reviews.title: easy upgrade to car stereo
customer_reviews.text: works great the 2nd one ive owned they work great to upgrade to Bluetooth to the car
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: The best Bluetooth receiver I’ve ever used
customer_reviews.text: I love how well made is it , doesn’t feel cheap and it has a very good sound quality also one of the best mic you can use in a call, very clear sound And the most important feature is you can use it while charging it.
customer_reviews.author: Mohamed Haroun

customer_reviews.title: Good Bluetooth Option
customer_reviews.text: This device allows me to play music in my truck through my iPod touch by plugging it in to the auxiliary port on the stereo. It streams the music clearly with no interruptions or drop outs. The battery life is around 3-4 hours. I keep the charging cable and a USB adapter that plugs in to the car in my truck in case it dies on me. The only drawback is that you have to hold down on the power button for a minute to turn it on or off. It also does have a constant flashing blue light when in use if that bothers you.
customer_reviews.author: Darren

customer_reviews.title: the mic is what im most impressed with
customer_reviews.text: the speaker has been phenomenal for me. i drive a tundra and have it plugged directly into the aux jack...which is about dead center of my dash between the seats. i have had no complaints of wind, echo, or static even when the windows are wide open. pairing with my galaxy s4 is easy. calls can be answered with the pairing button. it would have the 5th star if it had music skip controls. i would purchase again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Joe B

customer_reviews.title: Helps communicate
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to help my husband be able to talk hands free. Will let you know later how it works.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Bence

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised. Music was clear and received no issues about call quality when making hands free calls. An issue I have on some occasion is that it doesn't sync to my phone some times and I'll have to do it manually in the settings; not sure if that's the devices fault or my iPhone. A design flaw with this device is the single button, wish they added buttons to skip & rewind; just for convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Xyooj

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to bump and break while in car radio, worked great before that though
customer_reviews.author: Ben Fields

customer_reviews.title: A great solution for bluetooth connectivity and hands-free dialing
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I am very happy with this purchase. The device works reliably and surprisingly well, given the price. It connects easily to my iPhone 4S, and has good microphone clarity. The only gripe I have is that the sticky/velcro connector at the base is pretty lame. I'm not sure whether it's melting all the time, or whether it's just low quality, but I frequently have to re-mount it to the dashboard. Aside from that one gripe, this is a great product. I'd highly recommend it to anyone who wants to easily add in bluetooth connectivity to their car.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Probably bad design. Worked pretty well up until then
customer_reviews.text: Mine worked for a couple of months then the plug on the bottom broke. It just presses up inside the case. You constantly have to press the button on top to connect, so not sure how to avoid this from happening. Probably bad design. Worked pretty well up until then.. Oh on the velcro disk that comes with it.. It will slide with heat of the car. leaving goo behind..
customer_reviews.author: allenk

customer_reviews.title: As advertized
customer_reviews.text: Voice quality is clear. Delayed back echo back from my car speakers to caller is as others have mentioned. Turning down car speakers helps. I don't know how this problem can be avoided. It's simply a function of using the car speakers and feedback.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel T.

customer_reviews.title: Great give it a try!
customer_reviews.text: Best I've found for bass and clarity and loudness. Ever other one always compromises on one or the other. With this one I’ve found it has a winning noise when it's being charged but once the music is on you don't hear it at all. Broke after about a year and half but to be honest I abused it and the aux broke. Buying again!!
customer_reviews.author: Trashpanda

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: after having bought and been dissapointed with several other items, and using a direct line in with a ground loop isolator, I came across this item which was a decent price with a decent review. I love it...I use it for phone calls and stream Pandora and my library and it works wonderfully. I have the same complaint as others if you use it for the GPS without playing music, it goes into stand-by and takes a second or two of low volume before it picks up, so you miss some directions. Next time I will see what happens if I listen to music...Off to buy another for my wife.
customer_reviews.author: Jguitarsandcars

customer_reviews.title: no charging
customer_reviews.text: everything was working fine until today, now the unit wont charge. tried to reach out to the sellers site. no help from them, the have a "knowledge base" which does nothing but loop to itself when you try to click on it. no contact phone number and the only contact method is through an email form that does not give confirmation that email was ever sent. im afraid i will be at a loss here. DO NOT PURCHASE THIS PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo

customer_reviews.title: Expertly well designed!!
customer_reviews.text: The design group for this product took the time to make this EASY and LOGICAL to operate. Callers say they can hear me fine. Audio quality from a streaming source is excellent. I'm in/out of rental cars all the time and this is a perfect device that provides great inbound/outbound audio. The ONLY little suggestion I have is to make the LED either more directional or less visible. WAY too bright for night driving with some vehicles based on where the unit lives. WELL DONE!!
customer_reviews.author: Hiker Mitch

customer_reviews.title: A perfect sub for bluetooth car installation kit
customer_reviews.text: After researching these Bluetooth adapters, I decided to go with the cheapest one (GGgroove SMARTmini). With the exception of the light that is beaming into your eyes at night, this products has been fantastic. I do not use the base because I don't like the wires hanging, so I plug the device straight into the AUX jack (conveniently located next to the radio) and it has done wonders. The only time people have trouble hearing me is if the heat is blasting or the windows are down (understood). I recommend this product given the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Great except for the build quality (defective in less than a year)
customer_reviews.text: Product worked great but the build quality is pretty bad. Sadly in less than a year it has broken. The jack has come apart inside the unit so it will not stay properly seated in the AUX input. This device was left in my car at all times plugged in so I know it wasn't an issue of wear and tear on the unit. I have owned this device for almost 7 months and now it's just scrap. No warranty coverage either (shame on me). Hoping to find an even better replacement since I couldn't recommend buying this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Rico

customer_reviews.title: Oh my - amazing
customer_reviews.text: Considering the price, I wasn't expecting much... but this has got to be the best-sounding bluetooth audio adapter I have ever used. I have it in my car for music - I'm hearing new detail in the music that I wasn't hearing when I was playing it wired. The device is very small, and is battery powered. The headphone-jack stand isn't necessary (I plug it straight in to the AUX jack), but I may use the stand later if I find that the microphone picks up too much road noise.
customer_reviews.author: K. Mudge

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but battery life could be better
customer_reviews.text: This works great, with the only downside being battery life. It seems to last about 6 hours, like they say, but that can get annoying sometimes. You could have it plugged in, but that defeats the purpose of cleaning up wire clutter. Aside from that, I love it. It does a good job of connecting to my phone, and automatically shuts off after losing connection, so I don't have to manually shut it off when I leave my car.
customer_reviews.author: Remus Vintila

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: I am in the car a lot and don't like things in my ears so wanted something like this. The voice quality is good according to the people I call. It is hard for me to know when the phone and device are connected or when the device is on or charged. The instructions don't give much help. I bought a car charger to go along with this so I just keep it charged in all the time, but I do need to stop to ensure I am connected when I want to make a call.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my wife and it works as advertised. I ended up buying a ground loop isolater to use with it to eliminate "engine noise" in the calls. It synced up pretty easily and she loves being able to stream music with the cable. The only downside is the quality is not close that of built in bluetooth systems. I understand this is an add-on, so we accept this limitation. For the price, this is best one I've found, and we've tried several.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony M. Crotwell

customer_reviews.title: Clear Voice Calls!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a New Potato bluetooth device years ago that was expensive and didnt include Bluetooth calling. At just a fraction of the cost, this does it all. Music plays through speakers without issue, and my friends say they can hear me crystal clear when I am driving, which says a lot because my Scion xB is pretty loud. I recommend this to anyone who wants to have the experience of a built in bluetooth system. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: T. Lott

customer_reviews.title: The price was good, and the product works pretty good
customer_reviews.text: The price was good, and the product works pretty good. The sound is not quite as good as an AUX cable, but it's worth it for the convenience of not having to mess with another cable. Bluetooth connections don't drop, but it does sometimes take a couple of tries before it makes a successful connection to a brand new Android phone.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Patton

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: Good battery life, nice audio quality and very reliable as a hands-free phone option. It would be perfect if it would turn off more quickly when out of bluetooth range of the phone to preserve battery, but it does the job very well even as it is. It does eventually shut off when disconnected, but I believe it does so after 15-20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Man

customer_reviews.title: Great for music.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the GOgroove SMARTmini AUX Bluetooth Audio Receiver for my Toyota Fj Cruiser. It works well for music. It sounds great and I haven't notice a difference between the Bluetooth and standard AUX cord. I use it everyday and the battery last for weeks. When it does die, I plug it directly into the lighter socket with an adapter. There is no need for it to ever leave my vehicle. The one thing I never use it for is for phone calls. It doesn't have very have good microphone range, but with that being said, I purchased it strictly for music streaming (reason for 3 stars).
customer_reviews.author: Lou H.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for, wish the sound quality was a little better on the microphone
customer_reviews.text: Connected via bluetooth without issues. Charge lasts for days, I think a couple of weeks. Great for streaming songs via bluetooth. Sound quality for speakers is great. Microphone's sound is a little soft and doesn't seem to have noise cancellation. Picks up ambient noise very easily, plus if you don't place the unit right in front of your face, the person on the other end of the call has a hard time hearing what you're saying.
customer_reviews.author: Nicky

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a wireless option to listen to music and receive calls in my 2007 VW Jetta. For some unknown reason, VW decided to put the AUX jack in the glove box, which has always made it awkward to connect a device since wires hang everywhere, and then eventually the wire gets worn out and needs replaced. I hooked this up a few days ago to try it out and it worked flawlessly. I made a few calls while driving and the quality was excellent. Couldn't be happier with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Y.

customer_reviews.title: Good item
customer_reviews.text: This item lives up to my expectations. Since my car doesn't come with a bluetooth, I figured that I would give this a shot. It pairs relatively easy and works pretty well for calls and music. Sometimes if you are not playing any music or talking to anyone it will produce some static noise. No opinion on battery life because I mostly plug it in when I am using it and if it's not being used it will turn off automatically so you don't have to worry about the battery dieing with just one use. Would recommend this over the more expensive units.
customer_reviews.author: eqjunkie829

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME DEVICE!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome!!! It doesn't the job and it has great quality. It looks very nice and professional (and cool) and it's mounting kit makes it easy to place in an accessible and convenient way! My only complaint is that when I want to use my phone instead of the blootooth it keeps trying to change it back to the device. Additionally, it makes an annoying beep when it needs to be charged but it doesn't show any other indication (like a red light) that it needs to be charged I just had to guess that...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It does not power off when I leave the car
customer_reviews.text: It does not do any good to have it connected to my car audio AUX input when the car & car audio is turned off. It would have been really great that if it turned itself off when the power charging cable does not have power any more, i.e., I turn off/leave the car, and get into my house. Other than that, the call quality is pretty good. It's just the pain having to turn it on/off whenever I get in/out of the car.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Kim

customer_reviews.title: Good looking device, but the base broke
customer_reviews.text: After using this receiver for a couple of months, the base just broke where the jack goes in without any reason. Now the receiver is loose and rotates freely. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Marcelo Delgado

customer_reviews.title: Finally I am wireless!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Chrysler 300 and it is bluetooth enabled. I can talk through my car but can't stream music. Strange. So I would use an audio cable and plug it into the AUX port in my car. That was a pain in the but because the cable got in the way sometimes while driving. And when I parked the car, I would have to unplug the cabled and wrap it up neatly and then put it away. This adapter is cool! Just plug it in, and go! Park the car, unplug it and walk away!
customer_reviews.author: black64

customer_reviews.title: Product works, but do you really need it? UPDATED
customer_reviews.text: The product itself works fine. I do have to pair it with my phone every time, which is kind of a downfall. I don't really know if this has any benefit over just plugging my phone into the aux. audio port though. UPDATE: This device is nearly impossible to charge. It is really a poor design using a 3.5mm jack as the charger instead of a micro USB port. The charger never makes connection and it never gets charged.
customer_reviews.author: TopherT1

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a huge fan of this thing. It doesn't fit very well in the AUX port on my dashboard (Pontiac G6), it doesn't sound as good asI have, and people talking to me have a hard time hearing me. I kept it around to plug into other people's dash on road trips and such, mostly because I lost the box when I got it, but I wouldn't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Korpenfelt

customer_reviews.title: Ok for music but not talking
customer_reviews.text: Initially I loved this device, but after time, not so much, I get a lot of complaints from people who can not understand me in the other end, had my wife trie it, and it sounds like she is in a tunnel with the window open. It does stream music very well, but after a few months the button stopped functioning. It also doesn't hold a charge very long so it must be plugged in all the time
customer_reviews.author: ARN1164

customer_reviews.title: excellent hands free device
customer_reviews.text: if your car has an aux input jack, this device allows hands free cell phone use using yor car speakers. aftermarket blue tooth hands free devices tyically cost twice as much and the installation can be a pain. with this device, the installation is as simple as plugging it in. in my car however, you need to manually switch audio input to make calls. i would highly recommend this for anyone looking for hands free device in their car.
customer_reviews.author: Leem

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little device that works in the car as well ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little device that works in the car as well as the home. You just plug it into any auxiliary jack and you can play anything from my mp3/iPod. I was very surprised at the quality of the microphone. I called my wife to test it out. It was about 2 feet from me, but she heard me just fine. The sound quality isn't the best, but hey, it's 2 feet away! Great unit for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Stapponit

customer_reviews.title: Durable.
customer_reviews.text: I don't really write reviews on products I buy but this Bluetooth adapter deserves one ,I purchase this little guy back in 2013 and this weekend it gave it last breath.I was sad to see him go but it served me well if you're looking for a good Bluetooth adapter you can't go wrong with this one.
customer_reviews.author: cloks67

customer_reviews.title: Good Bluetooth Accy
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing little piece of kit. I got one to use in my convertible so I could do bluetooth audio via the aux input. I am super impressed with sound quality and the life of the battery. I don't love the charge cable, I wish it was USB to mini USB, but that doesn't detract from use. Goes a long way to keeping my car interior free of cords and nonsense while driving.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Really great product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I was kind of nervous at first about the call quality that I would get from this product, but everyone seems to hear me regardless of what is going on in the car. I use this a lot with my media and the sound quality of my music is great. I haven't had any problems at all with this product. It was easy to set up and for the price you really can't beat it. I would totally recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: F. C. Warren

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little bluetooth accessory.
customer_reviews.text: This thing works like a charm and makes voice calling easy. Switches from the music I'm playing to incoming calls w/out an issue. It works while plugged in, as well as not plugged in. I simply just plugged it into my aux and didn't mess with positioning it elsewhere, and it worked great! People can hear me more clearly through the microphone on this than when I'm actually talking into my phone. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Abby Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: PROS: Works well with my Galaxy SIII and iPhone 4s Microphone seems to work well (with proper placement) Good sound quality CONS: Only one velcro mounting circle included in package - better pick a place and keep it there. Doesn't seem to auto-power off (not sure if this is just me), so the rechargeable battery still drains even when not in use Overall, it is still a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Street

customer_reviews.title: Also does a supremely bad job with dictation but maybe that's the phone
customer_reviews.text: The audio quality is okay but I have to do quite a bit to get this thing to connect. Maybe I'm doing something wrong but I have to hold the button down for a while and then it connects maybe 1 out of 3 times without digging into my iPhone's Bluetooth settings. I have a $7 shower speaker that connects more reliably than this. Also does a supremely bad job with dictation but maybe that's the phone. All in all, It's almost less convenient that just using an aux cable.
customer_reviews.author: SharkParty

customer_reviews.title: It pairs very easily and quickly
customer_reviews.text: This product is exactly what I needed. My phone's headphone jack broke and I refuse to listen to the radio so I bought this. It pairs very easily and quickly. I use it everyday with my Samsung Galaxy phone on my commute to and from work and the SMARTmini stays charged almost all week. Sound quality is also very important to me and it is great with the SMARTmini. I have only good things to say about this, ditch your aux cables that create unsightly clutter and get the SMARTmini.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great device. i have 2
customer_reviews.text: great device. i have 2. one for the truck ,using the aux, i stream my itunes,ect. the 2nd i use with the PA. and works great. phone calls are as good too.
customer_reviews.author: Danny W Galloway

customer_reviews.title: Works great, don't regret it.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised Pros: battery last a long time. I have it set about 2 feet away and friends say that I sound loud and clear. Con: Not really a con, but if i leave the bluetooth area my phone will disconnect and mini aux shuts off.It's a bit of a hassle to turn back on everytime i get back in my car. I haven't really looked into to it and not enough to go to four stars because its a great product
customer_reviews.author: rockon0921

customer_reviews.title: This works great for both in his truck
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my friend who has an F150 truck and came only with the Bluetooth for calls and text messaging but no media connection. This works great for both in his truck. The sound is fuzzy at times but not a big deal. You can still hear very clear. The unit works fine when charging as well. I will be ordering two more for my sister and my dads car. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: H. Arturo Montero

customer_reviews.title: OK...it does work (iPhone 5s)
customer_reviews.text: It's OK. It doesn't compare to a factory installed option but it performs well enough streaming music; although sometimes I have to adjust the sound settings in my car to make it a little clearer (usually with talk radio). The microphone works but people say there is some background noise and at times they have a hard time hearing me. For the money, size of device, and streaming music...I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: TB

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver - when it works
customer_reviews.text: This little gadget has allowed me to play music and speak on the phone in the car hands free. It is small, quite attractive with crystal clear audio. I'd recommend it to anyone and I'm now considering attaching one to my computer speakers for a wireless experience. Update 1/3/2015 - Unfortunately I have to downgrade from 5 to 3 stars. It stopped working after upgrading to iOS8. No matter what I do I can't get it to pair.
customer_reviews.author: daneonb

product_meta.title: Car Bluetooth Receiver Stereo AUX Adapter with Handsfree Calling by GOgroove - SMARTmini AUX - Portable 3.5mm Wireless Music A2DP Adapter Dongle with 30-Foot Streaming for Smartphones & Tablets
product_meta.description:
GOgroove SMARTmini Bluetooth In-Car 3.5mm AUX Receiver Kit

Bluetooth Audio Receiver
Instantly equip any 3.5mm enabled car or home stereo with Bluetooth audio and hands-free calling capability! The SMARTmini AUX harnesses the power of Bluetooth to allow a wireless connection to virtually any Bluetooth-enabled device. It also comes with a built-in noise cancelling microphone so you can stay focused on the road while taking calls on the go.

Pair Up and Plug In
To pair, simply hold the power button for 6 seconds, connect your phone and you are ready! For added convenience, auto-connect can be performed with the last paired device. After pairing, all you need to do is insert the 3.5mm plug into the AUX line-in port of your car or stereo sound system. Use the included Velcro mount to perfectly place the device and you are ready to wirelessly stream audio!

Rechargeable
The SMARTmini AUX can be used for up to 6 hours and recharges in 1.5 hours. To charge, plug the included USB charging cable into any USB port and you will be ready to stream crystal clear audio in no time!

Tech Specs:
Bluetooth Version: 2.1 + EDR
Frequency Range: 2.4GHz - 2.48GHz
Operating Distance: Up to 30ft
Output: Standard 3.5mm audio plug
feature_bullets: WHAT IT DOES – The SMARTmini AUX replaces your AUX cord and plugs into the 3.5mm input of your speaker or car stereo so that they can wirelessly play streaming audio & take calls from your phone
CAR STEREO BLUETOOTH UPGRADE MADE EASY – You need a car with a 3.5mm AUX port for the SMARTmini adapter, and also a USB power port if you want the adapter to have an always-charged battery
ULTRA CLEAR HANDSFREE CALLS – The SMARTmini AUX built-in microphone features noise-cancelling enhancements for ultimate talk clarity during phone calls and virtual assistant commands
COMPLETE BLUETOOTH KIT – Includes everything you need for both a portable setup and also a more permanent installation on your dashboard (comes with an auxiliary mount and a 3.5mm extension cable)
3-YEAR MANUFACTURER WARRANTY – Tech Specs: Operating Distance: 30 Feet | Charging Time: 1.5 hours | Audio Playback: 6 hours per charge | Bluetooth Profiles: HSP, HFP, A2DP, AVRCP

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars1,134 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
